website_summaries.verdict: Powerful, yet sturdy, and smooth to operate, this top-notch scroll saw offers extra features that makes detail work easy for hobbyists and professionals alike.
pros: Users like the numbered blade tension dial, and blades are very easy to change
cons: A few reports of blade alignment being significantly off center
Bevel control knob broken for some users on arrival

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed! The speed suddenly will slow down
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed! The speed suddenly will slow down. This will happen when turning the saw on prior to cutting or when cutting. I emailed Dewalt customer service and did not receive a reply regarding the issue or what could be done to correct it. For the price, this is totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Crafter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was a first timer and did hours and days of research before I finally decided to start with the best (According to the reviews). None of the other ones seemed worth it. I’m artistic but not tool savvy, but I figured it out on my own. It was an easy and quick set up. Even before I mounted it I was impressed with how sturdy it was and how little it shook while using. My first project was to turn a wooden sawhorse into a scroll saw stand so I didn’t have to buy one. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Too much spacing between upper blade clamp and lower blade clamp
customer_reviews.text: The DeWalt DW788 scroll saw is a very fine tool which I have successfully used to make very intricate fret work for the past 20 years. My original unit was beginning to have too much play in the upper arm so I decided to purchase a new one. The New unit was obviously manufactured incorrectly with a spacing between the upper blade clamp and the lower blade clamp of 5.0 inches. This was too wide to enable the mounting of a 5.0 inch blade. My old unit had a spacing of approx. 4.32 inches. I would re-order if you can guarantee that the new unit spacing would be close to 4.32 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Blakely A. Eyster

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: We run a woodshop and use scroll saws frequently. This saw is a waste of money. First one lasted 2 weeks before the motor blew. Amazon replaced the unit and the second saw stopped working on 3 weeks. Replaced brushes and fuses still broke. Not worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: Melodee shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy and lots of vibration
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the saw for about two weeks and it worked like a charm. I made a few projects and suddenly the saw started making very loud knocking noises and vibrating like crazy. I’m sending it back in hopes of getting a replacement that will function as it should. For now, I am extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Great scrollsaw. was delivered via ups on time
customer_reviews.text: Great scrollsaw. was delivered via ups on time. I expected there to be more damage due to the weight of the product but only a little nic on a non essential part and didn't effect the performance of the tool whatsoever. I use this saw all the time and has become a quintessential part in my arsenal of tools. Quiet, smooth, easy to operate. Love the variable speed and the air hose is great at keeping the cutting area clean. I highly recommend this saw to anyone that likes to do intricate cutting. 5 stars easy.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: This saw is by far the best thing since the napkin
customer_reviews.text: This saw is by far the best thing since the napkin. If you do inside work where you feed the blade through a hole this saw is perfect because instead of takeing the blade completely out you only have to release blade tension loosen bottom screw & lift arm up.Then move piece to next hole & feed it in tighten bottom screw tighten blade & go.EASY EASY. The manual says feed from bottom, if you can your better than me. GREAT SAW
customer_reviews.author: JeneaSwainston

customer_reviews.title: This is my 2nd DeWalt 788. Sent the first ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd DeWalt 788. Sent the first one back because of the well known blade back and forth issue. Sadly the replacement is doing the same thing. On the fence of sending this one back as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blade wobble makes saw unusable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in December of 2012, after I assembled it the blade had a terrible front to back wobble. I exchanged it for a new one and after I assembled this one I had the same problem. I dislike the saw so much I hardly ever scroll saw any more. It is impossible to do intricate work. I could have exchanged it again but was afraid I'd get the same result. I have talked to other scrollers and they love their saws, maybe it was a design problem that year...anybody want to buy a saw???
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw, missing key parts!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, heavy duty. Unfortunately, arrived without the thumbscrews to hold blade in place. So, dilemma...hassle with return or hunt on we for thumbscrews or go to local hardware and try to find right size. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kim S.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: My old scroll saw was old (not sure when it was manufactured as I inherited it from a relative who passed). It would no longer hold the tension and changing the blade took 3 hands. I purchased this saw after reading reviews for most of them. The price was reasonable in comparison. It seemed as if my skill level was very limited using the old saw. The first time I used this one, I was amazed at the ease of use, very quiet in comparison, easy to change blades. Using this saw I found my skill level to be much better than I thought. I am very pleased with it. I do mostly 3D cut projects. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. L.

customer_reviews.title: good product maybe
customer_reviews.text: lost the first one through fedex second one came broke so I did not want to go three times a charm so I when through another dealer got nothing but hard time from amonzon
customer_reviews.author: DLM

customer_reviews.title: great saw...
customer_reviews.text: this is my first scroll saw i've owned but we had 3 of them at college and everyone seemed to love them esp. my teacher... i've only made one project so far but i've had no problem with it at all... assembly was super simple and after clamping to the bench top i have no vibration issues at all... i got the lifter arm and that works as advertised but once i installed it i realized that the "big foot" one would have been a better fit for me...
customer_reviews.author: yinn2yangTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: STURDY
customer_reviews.text: Another great Dewalt product...found perfcet light upgrade at Amazon = harmiey Sewing Machine Light (40LED) 8W Gooseneck Work Light with Magnetic Mounting Base White Soft Light for Lathes Drill Presses Workbenches
customer_reviews.author: vincent Nardozza

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to replace a 25 year old Hegner (German made) multi-max scroll saw. While the new Dewalt has an easier blade change system I am disappointed in the hold down arm assembly. On the Hegner the arm shaft went through a HOLE and was secured with a thumb screw providing a more formidable method to secure it in the proper position. The clamp on method on the Dewalt leaves much to be desired. The hold down arm of the Hegner was a better design. I have only used the new saw for a few projects at this time and am pleased with it's other aspects .
customer_reviews.author: Alexander J. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts no manual
customer_reviews.text: Im not sure if this is common with dewalt scroll saw but normally when i spend close to 500$ i expect to recieve a manual and all the parts to assemble it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw!
customer_reviews.text: This was my xmas present to myself and I am super glad I went with this saw. The blower is a little worthless and I wish it has a rip fence, but everything else about this scroll saw is perfect and better than any scroll saw I've used before. It barely has any vibration which allows you to be very precise. It's very easy to change blades and even easier to quickly thread a blade through a project. I have used it for plywood, common boards, hardwood, and plexiglass with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Cook

customer_reviews.title: A great scroll saw
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a scroll saw before but bought it when I became interested in fretwork and intarsia. Watched a boat load of you tube videos before getting it, and it was a pleasure to use this scroll saw once I got it. So glad that I read lots or reviews on deciding the right one. It has become my favorite equipment along with my jigsaw and router. I take great pleasure cleaning and inspecting it after every use. Yes, it’s my OCD at work.
customer_reviews.author: Lotus

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, GET add-on!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly of the saw is flawless! I saw a comment that the blade wasn't centered in the blade cutout. Before you tighten the 2 screws that hold the table to the yoke, you must make sure the table is all the way back on the pin and center the table around the blade cutout before tightening (while table is parallel to the surface the saw is on. This will eliminate that issue. Too bad Dewalt missed the boat on design to facilitate blade changes. papasworkshop.org the "Lifter" is a MUST add on!!!
customer_reviews.author: gregg coroleuski

customer_reviews.title: Best scroll yet
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 3 different scroll saws and this is the best by far. It cuts smooth and true though all thickness of wood. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a good saw without having to pay in the thousands. I do wish they would put a sawdust port on it, but that is minor compared to the performance of the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!!! Good price. I could find it cheaper online at a couple of different places but I needed a payment plan which I got thanks to Amazon. Great scrollsaw! Works beautifully! Barely any noise, cuts great, although it really depends upon your blades. Best present for myself ever!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer LAN

customer_reviews.title: Best Scroll Saw... Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and tried too many scroll saw and i like some of them, like the dremel moto saw, the Wen & Excalibur which was double the priceof this dewalt, but there's no comparison with this one it's Very smooth and quiet, so accurate with the right blade and the right blade tension, also blade is very easy to change, this one is really a great saw, it's a DEWALT... definitely recommend to anyone looking for the best..
customer_reviews.author: Remon

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt Tools Rock
customer_reviews.text: Another great tool by DeWalt. Set up was simple and easy. Operation is smooth. As a first time scroll saw user, was able to get up to speed and start producing quality output rapidly. Especially like easy blade attachment hardware. Very simple and fast to pull the blade through the work at the next opening, and re-attach to the upper arm. As a newbie, didn't realize how important this was at first - but its huge. High quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Best one to Buy
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Very well built. Very nicely packaged to protect the heavy item. Quiet operation. Powerful operation. Easy to pull from the box and go right to work. The air system works well to "puff" away the sawdust that builds while cutting (very good). The table is true and large enough for all types of scroll work. Blades are very easy to change----saw is very easy to use---very safe too. Priced a bit high but there really isn't competition at this level. I replaced an old Delta that I could no longer get parts for. I use the Dewalt stand and find this to be a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: DRT

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I am scrolling with the Cadillac of Scroll Saws
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I am scrolling with the Cadillac of Scroll Saws. The packaging was perfect and the set up was very simple. I have used it many hours already and am very happy with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: John Paul Brady

customer_reviews.title: Still running strong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw from Amazon 6 years ago and it’s still running strong. To be honest I’m not one who is kind or gentle to all tools. I know I push this saw far past it’s intended specs and it handles my “force-fullness” like a champ. Take the time and set your saw up right and it will serve you well. I did also add the lamp and it works well although I wish there was a way to shed wire the lamp into the saws cord so as to not have to plug in two cords, but that’s minor complaint.
customer_reviews.author: AKbeeNewbie

customer_reviews.title: For Beginners or Experts, The Right Machine
customer_reviews.text: On the stand the DW788 is steady, quiet and accurate. I set it up in my wife's craft room, showed her some basic practice exercises and turned her loose. She made some mistakes and she did some things right from the beginning. But, she is learning and getting better. Now I need to add dust collection as she is really wanting to do more.
customer_reviews.author: GBTtown

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: I really like the saw. I have a Wen and a Shop Fox and this is by far a superior saw. Its so smooth and cuts so much faster. It is really time saving when doing inner cuts, no tools needed and can adjust blade tension with a lever in seconds. I am upset with Amazon that 2 days after I purchased this saw it was $44.00 dollars cheaper and they would not refund me the difference. They said with the exception of TV's they don't offer post purchase adjustments. Shame on you Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: D Long

customer_reviews.title: New DeWalt 788 User
customer_reviews.text: I really miss the port on the table to be able to see where to install blades on the lower holder. I have the saw in my Den in my apartment and it runs quiet enough that I don't believe it disturbs my neighbors above or below me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product. Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Great Price!! You can spend a lot more on scroll saws and not get half the saw that this is. I do scroll saw work for sale and this saw keeps up with all my needs. It cuts any wood I have put it too. By the way my favorite blades to use with this aw are the spirals and it handles them just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Snooks

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this saw today and I have to say I'm very impressed. I consider a cheaper saw but so glad I upgraded to this unit. It is so quiet when not cutting you can barely hear it. The ability to raise the upper arm to insert your blade into internal cuts is a great option. The only small complaint I have is the blades that come with it although usable are not very high quality. So if you are considering a scroll saw bite the bullet spend the extra money, you will not regret it. I very rarely write reviews but I was so impressed with this saw I had to pass it on.
customer_reviews.author: jerrold s.

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money to get this saw, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new DeWalt DW788 scroll saw. Very easy setup and love the ease of blade changing or threading for inside cuts. Only disappointed that Dewalt does not come with a light and lift for supporting the "arm" in a raised position. Can be modified using "The Lifter" kit found online to overcome this which I did. Now I have a great saw that should last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and vibrates. Not a happy customer.
customer_reviews.text: First one was junk brand new out of the box. Second one isn't much better. Vibrates and is noisy. These are supposed to be smooth and quiet. I expected better for $450.
customer_reviews.author: jason rogers

customer_reviews.title: We were disappointed that it did not come with blades or an ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for Christmas. We were disappointed that it did not come with blades or an owner's manual. How can we get those? Shouldn't it come with them?
customer_reviews.author: J9

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this saw!!! This was my very first one and my review picture was only the second thing I’ve ever cut! The ease of this saw makes it great for beginners. I was super nervous to use it at first but it’s an awesome saw and I became comfortable very quickly. I would suggest getting a pedal just to make your life easier but I would absolutely recommend this saw
customer_reviews.author: KLo

customer_reviews.title: More money, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This one is more money than the others, as much as three times as much in fact. However it's worth it, The build quality is amazing. and it's rock solid on the stand that was designed for it. I'm getting back into wood working, and pulled the trigger on this after researching a bunch of them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Beaver

customer_reviews.title: Love Big Yellow!
customer_reviews.text: I use this saw pretty much on a daily basis. I do a lot of scrolling and I've had this saw since mid Feb and it is still going strong. I hope it will last for many years to come. My Shop Fox died after 6 months! The packaging was wonderful and there was a warning on top of the saw that tells not to try to lift it out of the box by the arm of the saw. Every thing was there and all I had to do was attach the table and then blade and put a hunk of scrap wood on it and then went on to scroll!
customer_reviews.author: Fay N. Prozora

customer_reviews.title: The saw itself is great.. the reason for 4 instead of 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: The saw itself is great.. the reason for 4 instead of 5 is because of the Dewalt stand designed specifically for this is TERRRIBLE. Find an alternate stand before making your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CustomerOne

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scroll saw. I use it mostly for making puzzles, but I also have used it to make small dolls for my grandchildren, and a hook out of cherry wood for when I pretend to be Captain Hook when we play together. It is intuitive and well designed, and should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: panama

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: If you've been thinking about it for a long time like me, take the plunge. You won't regret it. Like others that promise 'frustration free' blade changes, this one actually delivers. Sooooo easy! My guess is that a scroll sawer actually designed this. Happy scrolling :)
customer_reviews.author: Pipes

customer_reviews.title: I've wanted to try scrolling for a long time and I finally took the jump and purchased what I thought was the best equipment. I LOVE my DeWalt scroll saw
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in July. UPS guy thought it was for the man of the house. It was for me. I've wanted to try scrolling for a long time and I finally took the jump and purchased what I thought was the best equipment. I LOVE my DeWalt scroll saw!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra L.

customer_reviews.title: A good saw at this price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the scroll saw daily since I received it about a month ago. Even though it's a "Type 2", it seems to be working just fine. I had to tip the table a degree or so to get it to be perpendicular to the blade. No big deal, I just changed the angle indicator to 0 degrees once the blade was perpendicular to the table. I thought the price at $455 with free shipping was the best deal around until I found the saw plus table and light for $50 more somewhere else. Oh well, I'm pretty sure that's one of Murphy's laws.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome love it.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today, and man do I love it. I'm just starting out but this thing can do the craziest cuts ever. I did this design really quickly just to test it. I need practice but the machine was great!
customer_reviews.author: Jones Family

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my scroll. I bought it after doing a little research on brands and models, and I am definitely not disappointed. Prior to this purchase, I had never scrolled before. This was an easy product to learn on, as there aren’t too many parts to keep track of and it’s very self explanatory. Now that I have more experience, I’d recommend purchasing some higher quality blades than what comes with the saw, but that is very minor. The blades included were fine for me learning.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Turner

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: The best scroll saw, hands down!!!!!!!! This is simply an amazing price of machinery. There is absolutely nothing negative about this scroll saw. I used the portercable scroll saw for 3 years. I thought that saw was great until I used the dewalt. It is smooth and fast! I cut my time down by about 8 minutes! If you can buy it! You will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: If you want a scroll-saw, get this one.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic scroll saw. All the reviews I have read about this saw were right on. It is a great saw does a great job. One of the best things about it is blade changing. I don't think it could be any easier. The thumb screws are easy to loosen and retighten. Changing blades takes only seconds with a little practice. It is realitively quiet when it's running too. Much quieter that other saws I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Ron B.

customer_reviews.title: have issues with the top tension screw on the blade
customer_reviews.text: the scroll saw is nice to work with but the hold down shoe is not the best. The up and down rod for pressure on the foot is to short. So I had to add to it. Also the top tension screw wings just keeps turning so I have to use a plier to keep tension on the blad. Called Dewalt and got a run around. Would not send me a new screw...........
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy operation and blade replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Quick upper blade release. Added the Lifter. Controls conveniently located up front in easy reach. Very low vibration on faster speeds. Possibly eliminated when I bolt it down, as others have said.
customer_reviews.author: Austlec

customer_reviews.title: So quiet
customer_reviews.text: After having our first saw misplaced during shipping, Amazon sent another. It was easy to set up and so quiet. We attached it to the work bench with bolts and did not need a stand. Keeps my husband so busy, I have to remind him to mow the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Money Well Spent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Dewalt scroll saw for a specific project. It has met all my expectations and more. Having good tools makes a project enjoyable. I had considered saving some money and finding a used saw, but decided not to. This saw has been a pleasure to use and worth the money. Getting the light and the stand are essential unless you already have a light and stand.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hall

customer_reviews.title: I just cannot say enough about how great this saw is and for the price no one ...
customer_reviews.text: I just cannot say enough about how great this saw is and for the price no one could go wrong with this saw. This saw has cut the blade changing time in half and hassle free. Buy it!!!!!!! You will Love it
customer_reviews.author: Richard O.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Saw
customer_reviews.text: High quality scroll saw. Easy to set up and use. I purchased the dedicated cart, light and foot switch, all of which integrate together well.
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson W. Tilley

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: this is a wonderful saw. Was using a cheaper one and this machine is a game changer!! Easy blade installation, able to get good tension on the blade!!! very quiet. wish I would have got the stand.
customer_reviews.author: jronn65

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: The saw was easy to set up and start using. The table and blade were perfectly aligned and it works very well. I am going to add the "Lifter" to make inside cuts easier. Seems like for the price, Dewalt could include a lift device.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with damaged Dewalt Scrollsaws
customer_reviews.text: These saws would function very well if they arrived complete and undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Mckinnon

customer_reviews.title: below or above is fine, very nice design
customer_reviews.text: It vibrates on speed #5, below or above is fine, very nice design
customer_reviews.author: VL

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift so have not used much yet but so far has met all claim by Dewalt. Still figuring out putting blade in. Works great, have not noticed any vibrations yet. The light I ordered from buckeye has never arrived so do not have a light for it yet. I do not have any heat in my shop so will have limited use until warmer weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product and glad I bought it. Does what is says it does and blade changing very easy compared to what I had prior to this one. Very quiet like they said it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Edward I. Jocz

customer_reviews.title: Great Scroll Saw!
customer_reviews.text: I had a 21-inch scroll saw from another major competitor and this one far outweighs the other. The Dewalt model is very quiet, has little to no vibration and cuts 3/4 inch oak with minimal effort. I am very impressed with how it performs. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine J Rockwell

customer_reviews.title: a great saw.
customer_reviews.text: I love the saw. It is easy to use. real quite and easy to adjust the tension and to change the blades. Cuts real good.
customer_reviews.author: Dennia Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Saw blade difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: Installing the saw blade was extremely difficult; it took over an hour trial and error until it was finally installed. However, Once installed the saw worked wonderfully
customer_reviews.author: James Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Blade install a stretch
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give it a 5 for easy to use is it's a stretch to put a blade in, the blade must be installed at the very tip on each end for it to reach both ends on a standard 5" blade. Otherwise great saw, quiet, big table, cuts like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I went with this scroll saw
customer_reviews.text: So glad I went with this scroll saw. Reasonably priced but not cheap at all. No problems with vibration, cuts really well, love the air hose that cleans off the cut line as you work. I bought this just to have one, for no special reason, and have ended up using it frequently. Its one of those things that after you have one, its so handy, you use it more than you think you will.
customer_reviews.author: Sewing Snit

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Scroll Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is an extraordinary scroll saw. Top quality manufacturing and performance. I have been using mine for a couple of month and so far is very satisfied with this tool. It cuts through 1 1/2 inch hard wood very easy and preciselly. Great for Intarsia artists and serious woodworkers.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: Set it up and began using it the same day. Made some nice pieces. No complaints. Dewalt has been a reliable product for me.
customer_reviews.author: grinch

customer_reviews.title: Great scroll saw
customer_reviews.text: I researched quite a bit but the Dewalt was a little more expensive. I think worth it. Not that I know the difference because I love this saw. Hard to believe I have been working for so long without it!
customer_reviews.author: Custom Wood Dreams

customer_reviews.title: Don't look for long term use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scroll saw in January of 2014 and it already needs a new motor. I bought this because it is suppose to be the top scroll saw, it is not. My old Craftsman, that is about 18 yrs old, works better than this. Very dissappointed. I use it a couple of times a week which in no way is high use. I just took it in to get fixed and it will cost me $300 to get it fixed, Seriously, that is almost as much as I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Missing “included” items to operate. Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I took it out of the box and it didn’t include any blades, screws to stabilize the cast iron plate, or hex wrench! Unable to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw. It is a joy to use. We bought it after researching a lot of different ones and are very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Saw.
customer_reviews.text: This scroll is excellent in every way. I have even used this with diamond wire for cutting carbon fiber. Works flawlessly....speed control, blower, blade locks, tilt of the platen, etc. You have to buy the stand for it for really good use. The pair are perfect together and are heavy duty. Finish quality is very good, as with almost all Dewalt products.
customer_reviews.author: I.B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: great machine but not as easy as they say
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet machine. one feature is still tough is to line up pin less blades, and very unhappy you can not use pined blades. used only a couple times kept starting and stopping found wirer lose on variable control, for the money paid think it could of been built a little better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt DW788 scroll saw, a quality tool
customer_reviews.text: A very high quality tool indeed. My first project was a wooden gear clock and the Dewalt scroll saw did a great job on the delicate parts needed to complete it. It runs so smooth and quiet I was amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R Leininger

customer_reviews.title: so good. I've only used up to 3/4" stock but ...
customer_reviews.text: Very minimal vibration if any. Change-over is seconds. So far, so good. I've only used up to 3/4" stock but the challenge for 1.5" will be forthcoming. I did not receive a manual or registration card so I am curious how to register my new tool.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie J

customer_reviews.title: This is the best scroll saw I've used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best scroll saw I've used. What I really like is the very small amount of vibration that you feel in your hands when they're resting on the platten as you manipulate work into the blade. This is so much better than, say, a Dremmel, that it's incomparable.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Eddie

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: What a nice machine. I ordered it on Tues. and received it in 8 days in great shape. I got it with the stand and light and really enjoy working with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Young

customer_reviews.title: Love it,no problems
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for few months now and I am starting to really enjoy scrolling. This saw is powerful, really heaven duty and operates smoothly. Haven't had any problems. Highly recommend. PS The arm doesn't stay up when removing your work piece but there are scrollsaw websites that sell remedies for that. Really easy to find. They are small home engineers who came up with solutions. The Lifter is one I purchased
customer_reviews.author: Rattboy

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: I love this Scroll Saw. Very quiet and super powerful. I clamp it to a work table with C Clamps and it never moves. With the 20" Throat it clears most all of my projects with ease. Most all of my tools over the last 10 years have all been yellow and have no complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to change blades
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old Dremel scroll saw with the Dewalt. Works great, easy to change blades, tension is easy. Speed control is handy, as is the on/off switch. The large table is very handy for cutting larger projects. Glad I made the switch!
customer_reviews.author: John A. Theotonio

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scroll saw! It is very easy to use, very quiet, and vibration free! So much better than I hoped for!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: no side to side movement cuts great.
customer_reviews.text: I am a prime member so I ordered it, free shipping two work days it was at my doorstep. They told me it would be here on a Tuesday and I got it on Monday, took me 15 minutes to set up. I mounted it on my old scroll saw stand and was cutting within 30 minutes after delivery. Very little sound, no vibration, no side to side movement cuts great.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Newman

customer_reviews.title: Came broke 1 star, then sent back got a unbroke one thats works great
customer_reviews.text: Came broke 1 star, then sent back got a unbroke one thats works great
customer_reviews.author: Core Computer Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a few weeks now and it works well. I also use it with some special blades that cut metal. It cuts through 3/16 steel with no problem and it doesn't make the machine bawk at all. It does need to be mounted down though it it tends to vibrate a bit making it hard to do precision work.
customer_reviews.author: Saden Shard

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built, easy to use. Uses straight blades. A lock mechanism to hold up the arm would be great, not some aftermarket device or a block of wood.
customer_reviews.author: DBrown

customer_reviews.title: 1st scroll saw purchase
customer_reviews.text: After many reviews, I bought this saw based on what I read. Very very nice. Only problem again is packaging as Dewalt seems to damage goods then pack them. This is the third tool from Dewalt / Amazon in the last month that I have purchased and all three came damaged. Cosmetic but damaged. Overall great tools.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L.

customer_reviews.title: my old scroll saw vibrated and shook so bad, of course it was quite old
customer_reviews.text: my old scroll saw vibrated and shook so bad, of course it was quite old. But the Dewalt DW788 works great. No vibration at all.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mumper

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this saw
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this saw. Mine is 3 months old and I just had to order parts to repair it already. The upper blade chuck is cheap aluminum and the thumb screw is hard steel so the screw pulled the threads out of the blade chuck. I registered the saw with DeWalt Feb 11 2015 ab=nd also made an account on Dewalts site three times. When I attempt to sign on to contact Dewalt about my warranty it keeps saying the account does not exist, BUT they let me order parts and pay for them as a guest. The blade chucks are a 2 month back order, they must be selling a lot of them.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Z Folds

customer_reviews.title: Great saw better than my Excalibur 16" whose company was ...
customer_reviews.text: Great saw better than my Excalibur 16" whose company was very little help when I required a part. They only spoke French and I threw it away
customer_reviews.author: benji

customer_reviews.title: GREAT saw, GREAT price
customer_reviews.text: I have completely wore out two scroll saws in my craft business and was skeptical [ at best ] about this Dewalt, having never owned one. I make items cutting very detailed scroll art portraits of 3/32 Birch ply to cars and construction equipment made from scrap 2 X 6 pine and redwood, sometimes from seasoned oak. I have yet to have a problem with this great saw. Regardless of where the saw was made -- You cannot find a better saw for the money spent. The ease of changing blades is priceless when you have to change - like 987 times in a 12 X 16 portrait. GREAT job Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw. I upgraded from a cheaper saw and it made a world of difference for my projects. The noise is a minimal. The vibration is close to none. The precision of cut is wonderful, very easy to manuever. I haven't found anything I do not like about this yet and I've been using it for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: WTurner

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: have trouble using the hold down on the wood i'm cutting
customer_reviews.author: ron-mountaintop

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Good saw, easy to adjust, perfect for beginners,easy set-up. I added a foot switch, and a lift arm. The owners manual is useless ,get a book that let's you know how to use it .
customer_reviews.author: roger r

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about 5 months. Works like a dream. No issues. I wish I could find the exact blades that came with the saw. My replacements aren't the same.
customer_reviews.author: eeeccccccc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scrollsaw!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Got it 3 days ago and it is a dream machine. Very quiet compared to my 3 year old Porter Cable scrollsaw. Very smooth operating and relatively quiet. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: DDW

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The package with the saw, stand and light is an excellent value. No complaints or concerns. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bookzilla

customer_reviews.title: wow really are you kidding me. i was using ...
customer_reviews.text: wow really are you kidding me . i was using a craftsman 16in scroll saw and the Dewalt blows that away. I will never buy craftmans again. Its well worth the extra money to but this one. YOU get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have used this scrollsaw for 20 years and I would never change. I bought and excaliber for alot more money and it doesn,t even stand up to the Dewalt
customer_reviews.author: Marie Dent

customer_reviews.title: Best saw for the price Great for starting out when ...
customer_reviews.text: Best saw for the price Great for starting out when doing cool fancy artistic work
customer_reviews.author: Alex Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: under 1 year needs service
customer_reviews.text: march 23rd this scroll saw will be 1 year old, machine is making knocking sound . have to bring it in to service center . this machine for the price should last years under mild use . this machine lasted under a year with only about 2 months of total use . Not happy .
customer_reviews.author: click

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Works nice. Makes scrolling so much easier. Glad I bought it, but haven't used it as much as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Alyce

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love This Product. Great addition to my shop.. Work hours on these machine daily and so happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Bytty

product_meta.title: DEWALT Scroll Saw, Variable-Speed, 1.3 Amp, 20-Inch (DW788)
product_meta.description:
Double parallel link arm design dramatically reduces vibration and noise, for extremely accurate cuts. Exclusive tool-free blade clamps, On-off switch, electronic variable speed, flexible dust blower and blade-tensioning lever are all located on the front upper arm. Arm design pivots from the back of the saw to the front and lifts so blade can be easily threaded through the material for inside cuts. Unique arm design keeps the blade perpendicular to the work. Oversized, cast-iron table provides excellent material support and bevels 45 degrees left and right. Specs: Motor 1.3 amp rating, 120V AC. 400-1,750 cutting strokes per minute. Table size 16" x 23-3/4". Weighs 56 lbs. Meets OSHA standards, CSA approved and U.L. Listed. Stand Not Included . Featured length of the flexible shaft is approximately 22 inches long

AMAZON.COM
The dependable DEWALT 20-Inch Variable-Speed Scroll Saw is designed to help you create accurate, detailed workpieces with ease. Its user-friendly configuration with easy-to-access controls, reduced-vibration design, and variable-speed performance allow for incredible precision. For added convenience and durability, an integrated cast-iron table provides material support, and a flexible dust blower helps keep your work area pristine.



Unique Arm Design for Accurate Cuts
A scroll saw needs to perform both reliably and accurately, whether you're crafting custom jigsaw puzzles or designing unique trim pieces. This DEWALT scroll saw's double parallel-link arm design helps it deliver on both fronts by reducing vibration. The specially designed arm pivots from the back of the saw to the front, shortening the distance that the arm needs to move and allowing for smoother, quieter saw operation. With less vibration, you can produce accurate cuts with ease.This unique arm design also works to keep the saw's blade perpendicular to whatever you're working on, reducing the chance of over cutting or under cutting.

Easy to Handle with Variable-Speed Control
Adding to the saw's intuitive, design are convenient controls engineered by DEWALT to keep your workflow smooth. The saw's on-off switch, speed control, and blade-tensioning lever are all located within easy reach on the front, upper arm. The saw's flexible dust blower is also located on this portion of the arm so it can easily be directed where you need it, keeping your work surface clear of unwanted debris.

The scroll saw's electronic variable-speed control allows you to make quick, accurate adjustments and utilize speeds ranging from 400 to 1,750 strokes per minute. The saw relies on a dependable 1.3 Amp motor for the power you need and delivers a variable stroke length between 3/4 inch and up to 2 inches deep. This application-specific performance translates to improved control and cleaner results.

Save Time with Tool-Free Blade Changes and Adjustable Table
Whether you're working with a variety of specialty materials or you're simply ready for a more aggressive cut, the DEWALT exclusive, tool-free blade clamps allow you to complete blade changes in just seconds. And the arm is easy to lift, making it easy to thread the blade through materials when making inside cuts.

Weighing 56 pounds, this scroll saw has a heavy-duty feel yet is small enough to move around the shop easily. The saw's oversized, cast-iron table provides excellent support no matter what you're working on, and the table bevels 45 degrees to the left and 45 degrees to the right for added versatility.

This 20-inch variable-speed scroll saw comes with a DEWALT warranty package that includes a three-year limited warranty, a one-year free service contract, and a 90-day money-back guarantee.

What's in the Box
DEWALT 20-Inch Variable-Speed Scroll Saw, hex wrench, and blades.
feature_bullets: Double parallel link arm design dramatically reduces vibration and noise for extremely accurate cuts
Exclusive tool free blade clamps allow blade changes in seconds. Depth of Cut (inches): 2 inch
On off switch, electronic variable speed, flexible dust blower, and blade tensioning lever all located on front upper arm
Arm design pivots from back of the saw to front, shortening the arm movement for smoother, quieter operation
Arm lifts so blade can be easily threaded through the material for inside cuts
